document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Callipia Guenée, 1858 (Lepidoptera, Geometridae), with the description of 15 new taxa

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Callipia Guenée, 1858 (Lepidoptera, Geometridae), with the description of 15 new taxa

bibRefCitation.author: Dognin P.
bibRefCitation.journalOrPublisher: Mémoires de la Société entomologique de Belgique
bibRefCitation.refString: Dognin P. 1913. Heteroceres nouveaux de l'Amerique du Sud. Memoires de la Societe entomologique de Belgique 22: 1 - 54.
bibRefCitation.title: Héterocères nouveaux de l’Amérique du Sud

subSubSection.paragraph:
Callipia vicinaria
is one of the smallest known species of
Callipia
. It is closely related to
C.walterfriedlii
sp. nov. The spine-like processes on the ventral margin of the valvae are relatively short and the uncus is narrower than in the other closely related species. Other diagnostic characters are discussed in those species. COI-barcode: the minimum observed distance to the genetically most similar species (
C.walterfriedlii
sp. nov. ) is 3.3%.

subSubSection.paragraph:
ECUADOR : 1 ♂ , Napo , Papallacta , Rio San Pedro ,
3010 m
, 0.382° S , 78.124° W ( RCGB ) ( C-0390 , COI sequence 658 bp, BIN, Fig. 23 );
1 ♂ , 1 ♀ , same data as previous ( ZSM ) ( C-0391 ; C-0392 )
;
1 ♀ , same data as previous, but Cuyuja ,
2525 m
, 0.411° S , 78.022° W , ( ZSM ) ( C-0393 with GS, COI sequence 547 bp (2 bp gap), BIN, Figs 36 , 39 )
As illustrated. The extent of dark brown markings on the wings is more extended and pronounced in the Ecuadorian specimens ( Fig. 23 ) than in the males from Colombia ( Figs 20–22 ).
Colombia , eastern Cordillera to north eastern Ecuador , 2500–3200 m .
The female was unillustrated until now.
